title: Needs to extend virtual keypad capability
text:
This is a great product. I use it with my hubs, with my iPhone and iPads. I have recently discovered its Universal feature, which allows my flic to simulate a keypress on my PC and using something like Autohotkey accomplish a lot of new things.

I just wish their universal feature emulated a lot of â€˜virtualâ€™ keys, like F13 to F24. That way the hotkeys would not compete with software hotkeys.

I would love to have emailed this suggestion, but Shortcut Labs does not publish any emails addresses. A dubious practice.

title: Everyone is a critic
text:
I donâ€™t mean to nitpick. This app has a great, and it does everything the devs say it would.

That said, I want to pull the app up, auto-connect to my hub, and click the buttons as if I was pressing the actual button. 

Is that possible? Did I miss that in the mix of programming my shortcuts and connecting my smart devices? It seems too obvious to not have implemented...

title: Buttons=Great; iOS App=Terrible
text:
The Good:
The buttons are great! The batteries have lasted for over a year so far, and get used daily. The Bluetooth range is excellent in a 3200sq home and has never let me down. If it doesnâ€™t work, Homeseer has always been the culprit (shame on you Homeseer).
Even so, Homeseer really expands the otherwise limited functionality of the buttons.

The Bad:
First off, for a company all about connectivity and networking - it should be able to find networked attached devices without asking for the password on the bottom of the device.

Second, the app loses connection with the hub frequently while programming it.

Lastly, why the forced portrait mode? I use the keyboard with an iPad Pro and switch back and forth between Homeseer and Flic to test things out. REALLY annoying.

title: Awesome concept
text: Very cool concept, I really enjoy the product. It does need work with its system but I really find this product useful

Great potential but devs have a long way to go because I'd start getting more buttons for random tasks.

title: Nice button, unfinished product
text:
The buttons are very cute! The brand intents are nice. I wanted to live it. 

But the overall product is unfinished. Hardware and software lack the ability to really integrate it in a robust smarthome. 

The main concerns are:
- There is still no support for hidden wifi. 
- NO integration with smartthings. 
- No support of smarthome protocols beyond bluetooth. 
- no investigation information when things are not working (battery level, button or bases out of range...)

Good for playing !

title: Great product, great utility, but thereâ€™s a persistent bug
text:
I use my flic button to control my music in my old car, which is phenomenal because it turns it in to a basically handsfree system. I have it stuck on my dashboard and set up with my iPhone 8.

Developers PLEASE READ: roughly â…“ of the time when I first get in the car and try to use it, the app will not execute my music commands. Iâ€™ve tried lots of troubleshooting, but even when it doesnâ€™t execute commands, the button is still connected to my phone (as evidenced by the â€œConnectedâ€ status in my Bluetooth settings). Iâ€™ll even open the flic app and it will show that the button is connected, but will not recognize presses. Sometimes, it counts presses and still doesnâ€™t execute. Iâ€™ve found the only way to get it to work when this happens is to turn my Bluetooth (totally) off in settings and then turn it back on and ensure itâ€™s connected in the flic app. Sometimes it takes 2 or 3 tries. Itâ€™s incredibly frustrating because I never know when itâ€™s going to happen, and it defeats the goal of not using my phone while driving. Hopefully you can address this bug!

title: Works well enough, but playlist sub folders are buggy
text:
I use this primarily to switch between playlists, but my playlists are organized into folders - some of which are more than 1 level deep.  It works great for all the music on the first two "levels" in the Playlist filesystem.  The Flic app shows me all the music in the Playlist list AND all the music in any sub-folders, as expect.  But if I go any deeper than that (say, into a sub-sub-folder), I see nothing.  It's just a blank page - no music and the search bar is no longer responsive.  

I will upgrade this to 5 stars if this is fixed.  In order to use this I have to reorganize all my playlists such there are no songs more than 1 folder down, which is prohibitive.

Fun surprise tho:  if your playlists are set to shuffle by default, then binding a Flic button to them and clicking it will auto-shuffle the songs before playing the playlist.

title: Buyers Beware!
text: Believe the reviews before you buy one of these overpriced buttons that don't work.  To make matters work, their customer support is horrendous.  All you can do is send them your in app Bluetooth log and add a short description of the problem.  At which time, you'll be lucky if you even get a response (took me 3 times to hear back from someone).  Then when I finally did hear back the rep told me to try the button with another device.  I had explained in the description that I was trying to reconnect it to a device it was already connected to, and they I also tried connecting it to another device, I even put a fresh battery in to eliminate any possible variables.  Explained all that to the "support" person, and that was the response I got back.  Tried reaching out to them multiple times after that and no one responds.  This button and company is a joke.

title: Like a light switch, but on steroids
text: I know the Flic buttons can do more, but I primarily use them to control lights. Each button can control 3 different functions or scenes - press once to turn lights on low, twice for full brightness or press and hold to din the lights and turn on some music... you get the idea. Flic can be used instead of Alexa or apps or augment them. Theyâ€™re small and can be easily moved around or attached to anything - no DIY skills needed. Iâ€™ve also had occasion to contact customer support and found them to be responsive and helpful.

title: Yet another account?
text:
Yet another app that requires me to identify myself to the producers by signing up for an account.
All I want/need and all this app does for me is to operate a Bluetooth button for my phone.  Why does that require an Internet connection? Why does that require the flic to know who I am? Why does SHORTCUT labs need to record how and when I use the button? Interested in when I snooze my phone to sleep longer? 
It is so frustrating that every company these days just assumes we want to share our life with them just because we buy a tool from them. I'm not after a service and this particular company can neither provide any justifiable added value to me by storing my data in the internet, nor did it say anywhere on the app that it doesn't work without account.

title: Great product
text: Has a little improvement to be done. I would love to be able to access the functions without having to unlock my phone on ad open the app. Accessing Siri would also be cool. Overall the entire process is practically seamless and is very easy to understand. Some improvements are needed to make everything worth it but I am giving you a five star rating because I thing that it is already useful and for what can come out of this great idea!

title: Need to confirm tap on phone screen!?
text:
The button seems to function alright, the problem is that when you use a function like take a picture or navigate, it pops up a notification and you have to click that on the screen in order to open the camera app. That's pretty redundant and sort of defeats the purpose I think. 

I also assumed that actions like take a picture would use the native camera app. Instead it uses a Flic designed app which isn't ideal. At least it does save the photos directly into camera roll. 

Would love to see integration with more apps like waze and functionality like invoke Siri.

title: Love the way they work but app has sound issues
text:
1-The app only lets you configure sound on button presses across all buttons.   So they ALL play a sound on phone or none.   The app should allow setting for each button.
2-This is made worse by the fact that the app doesn't honor the iPhone physical silent switch.  If I have sound off I don't want to be disturbed.   So a bedside button for anything will play a sound an perhaps annoy partner.

Removed 1 star for each issue.

title: Shame!
text: These devices may work well with non-iOS devices, but here it's a lowly doohickey. To use a Flic one must ensure the app is running on the phone then press the Flic device to achieve the result. For instance; I wish to utilize a Hue light, I ensure that app is still awake (I haven't checked Mail and Safari since last app use) then I press Flic button to turn on light. For the same result I can launch a Hue app and select On. iOS may be restrictively a "walled garden" but that doesn't excuse the Flic manufacturer from stating that their device is compatible with iOS. You will achieve more satisfying results by acquiring $5 bills and setting them afire with a Bic.

title: WeMo support has been broken for 2 months
text: ...And there is no sign of a fix. Wemo integration was the only reason I bought like 10 of these little buttons for. Donâ€™t expect me to pay for you brand new hub, given your current efficiency on fixing Wemo. I will never trust small crowd-funded companies like you with my smart home setup in the future. title: Causes BTServer to crash
text:
Great app... Except that it causes the BT Server to crash, even when the app is not running.
If you are listening to music over Bluetooth, any CPU load (sending a text message, browsing the web, checking mail...) takes down your bluetooth connection.
I deleted the app and restarted my phone, all is back to normal.
Hopefully this big problem can be fixed soon but this app should absolutely be avoided if you rely on bluetooth audio.
